Smiths Fish&Chips
Moderators: ChiefKiasu , ClassMonitor
Page 1 of 6 [ 52 posts ] Go to page 1 , 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 6 Next
Print view Previous topic | Next topic
Author Message tankee Post subject: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Sat May 14, 2011 10:11 pm
ClassMonitor
Joined: Tue Jun 30, 2009 4:04 pm Posts: 14521 Location: Singapore just went to this Smiths Fish&Chips along Tanjong Katong for dinner this evening. They claimed to be British Authentic Fish&Chips.
Long queue for food and for table. Very crowded. We waited for about 15 minutes for a table and about another 5 min for our food (order was placed immediately upon arrival there). Tables are free-seating, much like food court, so there are people standing around waiting for others to finish.
Quite a few type of fish are on the menu including cod, haddock, plaice, halibut, dory, etc, plus chicken&sausage for non-fish lovers. No Tartar sauce, just salt&vinegar. The food are wrapped in paper, british-style, no plates.
We did not try their pickled eggs and pickled onions. Not daring enough
the fish was nice&fresh. definitely worth the wait.
Top
Happy Mama Post subject: Re: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Sun May 15, 2011 12:58 am
Councillor
Joined: Mon Nov 22, 2010 11:28 am Posts: 7303 What's the price point? Expensive?
Top
tankee Post subject: Re: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Sun May 15, 2011 1:15 am
ClassMonitor
Joined: Tue Jun 30, 2009 4:04 pm Posts: 14521 Location: Singapore from $10 for Dory to $20+ for the more expensive fish.
kids meal at $7
Top
Happy Mama Post subject: Re: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Sun May 15, 2011 1:25 am
Councillor
Joined: Mon Nov 22, 2010 11:28 am Posts: 7303 tankee wrote: from $10 for Dory to $20+ for the more expensive fish.
kids meal at $7
That's quite reasonable. Another place to try out.

QuiteKSMum Post subject: Re: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Sun May 15, 2011 6:02 am
BlueBelt
Joined: Sun Mar 13, 2011 6:20 am Posts: 335 Thanks tankee. Son is a f&c fan&we didn't get the chance to try British style f&c when we're there - will definitely try it here, thanks to yr sharing. (not too hot abt the wait thou - prob find a more off peak time to patronize ...)
Top
tankee Post subject: Re: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Sun May 15, 2011 10:14 am
ClassMonitor
Joined: Tue Jun 30, 2009 4:04 pm Posts: 14521 Location: Singapore no problem.
i did some googling just now. it seems that original fish&chips are made from Cod fish. yet to try fish&chips made from cod. wonder whether it is good.
Top
carebear Post subject: Re: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Mon May 16, 2011 11:51 am
KiasuGrandMaster
Joined: Sat Nov 22, 2008 10:38 pm Posts: 1017 Hi tankee, thanks for the suggestion! I will be going to siglap for massage tomorrow and was wondering what to eat until i saw your post. Will definitely drop by tomorrow to eat. Thinking of the cod and chips and the fried mars bars (i read about the fried mars bars on ieatishootipost.sg) really make my mouth water.
Top
tankee Post subject: Re: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Tue May 17, 2011 9:57 am
ClassMonitor
Joined: Tue Jun 30, 2009 4:04 pm Posts: 14521 Location: Singapore Fried mars bar? Sound tempting and scary at the same time.
How was it done? Covered in same batter as the fish?
Top
carebear Post subject: Re: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Tue May 17, 2011 6:11 pm
KiasuGrandMaster
Joined: Sat Nov 22, 2008 10:38 pm Posts: 1017 Finally made my way to the eatery. Free seating as mentioned by tankee. Some seats were inside and others outside. Menu is on the wall. Go in and order like a fast food restaurant and they will call your number when order is done. Ordered a cod and chips for $17- it was delicious and the meat was thick. The batter was unique. Battered mars bars were delightfully sinful - $5.
Things that i did not like were 1. No chilli sauce 2. No tartar sauce 3. Fish wrapped up in paper, no plates given so difficult to eat when it is windy. 4. Too much salt in the fries. 5. For that amount of money paid, i would expect better service.
Will I return for more? The answer is likely no, unless i happened to be in the vicinity and other food stores are crowded.
Top
yenny99 Post subject: Re: Smiths Fish&Chips Posted: Thu May 26, 2011 10:34 am
KiasuNewbie
Joined: Thu May 26, 2011 10:22 am Posts: 3 Will drop by and try their fish&chips, seems like there's quite a lot of positive ratings on it.
